API Reference¶

This section provides an overview of the main public modules and classes in QPFolio.

The API is organized into three layers:

  1. Core Modules — Problem generation, metrics, and visualization.

  2. Solvers — Abstractions and adapters for different backends.

  3. Data Utilities — Simulation and estimation helpers.

Core Modules¶

qpfolio.core.data.simulate_mvn_returns(n_assets, n_periods, seed=1)[source]¶

Simulate multivariate normal returns and return (R, mu, Sigma).

Return type:

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray]

qpfolio.core.estimates.sample_mean_cov(x, *, freq=1, ddof=1)[source]¶

Estimate sample mean vector and covariance matrix for asset returns.

Parameters:

  • (ndarray (- x)

  • (T (shape)

  • N)) (Return observations. Rows = time, columns = assets.)

  • (int (- ddof)

  • 1) (default)

  • (int

  • 1)

Return type:

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Returns:

  • - **mu (ndarray, shape (N,))** (Mean vector scaled by freq.)

  • - **Sigma (ndarray, shape (N, N))** (Covariance matrix scaled by freq.)

Notes

Annualization assumes returns are independent across periods. Scaling both mean and covariance by freq is the standard convention for small compounding intervals.

Examples

>>> import numpy as np
>>> rng = np.random.default_rng(0)
>>> x = rng.normal(0.001, 0.01, size=(252, 3))
>>> mu, Sigma = sample_mean_cov(x, freq=252)
>>> mu.shape, Sigma.shape
((3,), (3, 3))
qpfolio.core.models.build_dro_lite_problem(mu, Sigma, r_target, gamma=0.0, long_only=True)[source]¶

Moment-robust MVO: inflate covariance by gamma*diag(Sigma).

Return type:

ProblemSpec

qpfolio.core.models.build_mdp_problem(sigmas, Sigma, long_only=True)[source]¶

MDP via variance-min with normalization w^T sigma = 1.

Return type:

ProblemSpec

qpfolio.core.models.build_mvo_problem(mu, Sigma, r_target, long_only=True)[source]¶

Min-variance subject to target return and full investment.

Return type:

ProblemSpec

qpfolio.core.frontier.compute_frontier(mu, Sigma, targets, solver)[source]¶

Return list of (risk, ret, solution) along frontier.

Return type:

List[Tuple[float, float, Solution]]

Solver Interfaces¶

Bases: Protocol

class qpfolio.solvers.base.Solver[source]¶

Bases: ABC

abstractmethod solve(problem)[source]¶

Solve a QP and return Solution.

Return type:

Solution

class qpfolio.solvers.mathopt_osqp.MathOptOSQP(verbose=False, eps_abs=1e-07, eps_rel=1e-07, max_iter=100000, polish=True)[source]¶

Bases: object

Thin OSQP wrapper that understands either:

  1. OSQP triplet (A, l, u) [preferred], plus optional bounds

  2. Legacy (A_eq, b_eq, A_ineq, b_ineq) plus bounds

eps_abs: float = 1e-07¶
eps_rel: float = 1e-07¶
max_iter: int = 100000¶
polish: bool = True¶
solve(problem)[source]¶
Return type:

Solution

verbose: bool = False¶

Data Types¶

qpfolio.core.types.Array¶

alias of ndarray

class qpfolio.core.types.ProblemSpec(Q, c, A=None, l=None, u=None, bounds=None, A_eq=None, b_eq=None, A_ineq=None, b_ineq=None, G=None, h=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Generic QP container with light validation.

Objective:

minimize 0.5 * x^T Q x + c^T x

Linear constraints (two supported forms):

  1. OSQP triplet (preferred): l <= A x <= u

  2. Legacy equality/inequality + bounds (still supported): A_eq x = b_eq A_ineq x <= b_ineq bounds[i] = (lb_i, ub_i)

Notes

  • You may supply either (1) or (2). If both are supplied, the solver will prefer (1) and ignore (2).

  • Bounds are allowed with either form. When using the triplet, bounds are folded into (A,l,u) before calling OSQP.

A: Optional[ndarray] = None¶
A_eq: Optional[ndarray] = None¶
A_ineq: Optional[ndarray] = None¶
G: Optional[ndarray] = None¶
Q: ndarray¶
b_eq: Optional[ndarray] = None¶
b_ineq: Optional[ndarray] = None¶
bounds: Optional[Sequence[Tuple[Optional[float], Optional[float]]]] = None¶
c: ndarray¶
h: Optional[ndarray] = None¶
l: Optional[ndarray] = None¶
u: Optional[ndarray] = None¶
class qpfolio.core.types.Solution(x, obj, status, info=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Standardized QP solution container.

info: Optional[Mapping[str, Any]] = None¶
obj: float¶
status: str¶
x: ndarray¶

Developer Notes¶

  • All modules use type hints and are mypy-compatible.

  • Each optimization model returns a qpfolio.core.types.ProblemSpec object.

  • Solver adapters return a qpfolio.core.types.Solution object with fields: x (weights), obj_value (objective value), status, and info.
